definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Death in High Society by Inez Holden.
sentences.chinese: 死在上流社会的两大霍尔登。

sentences.english: I feel like a fish out of water among those high-society people.
sentences.chinese: 和那些上流社会的人在一起，我感到很不自在。

sentences.english: This is hardly the high life, she says.
sentences.chinese: 这几乎和上流社会的生活格格不入，她说。

sentences.english: All the elegance, all the refinement of high society was gathered there.
sentences.chinese: 上流社会的所有高雅和精致都被集中在那儿。

sentences.english: High society, always like to do some dirty thing.
sentences.chinese: 上流社会的人，总喜欢做点下流的事。

sentences.english: They are the leaders of society.
sentences.chinese: 他们是上流社会的顶尖人物。

sentences.english: She was introduced into upper society.
sentences.chinese: 她经人介绍进入上流社会。

sentences.english: If he real belongs to the upper ten, why did he come to Tomorrow Village?
sentences.chinese: 要真是上流社会的人干嘛到明日乡来啊？

sentences.english: Both of Jackie's parents come from the high society of New York .
sentences.chinese: 贾姬的父母皆来自纽约上流社会。

sentences.english: Unlike those wealthy people from the upper class, she is patriotic.
sentences.chinese: 不像那些来自上流社会的有钱人，她知道爱国。

sentences.english: After the scandal, Mr Booth was cast out of the best society.
sentences.chinese: 出了这件丑闻以后，布思先生被上流社会所摈弃。

sentences.english: When he fulminated against fashionable society he always spoke of its "trend";
sentences.chinese: 当他怒斥上流社会的痼疾时，总是说起它的“潮流”。

sentences.english: The ball organised by that club was a blue- blooded event.
sentences.chinese: 那个会社筹办的这次舞会是上流社会活动。

sentences.english: Professor Emerson Sillerton was a thorn in the side of Newport society.
sentences.chinese: 西勒顿教授是新港上流社会的眼中钉。

sentences.english: They bought into a dream of upward mobility and were effectively cheated.
sentences.chinese: 他们梦想着有一天走向上流社会却着实的被欺骗了。

sentences.english: Sergeant Parrott normally spoke with an upper- crust accent.
sentences.chinese: 帕罗特军士说话通常带着上流社会的腔调。

definition: high official and noble persons (idiom); the great and the good
lit. dazzling with paper and gold (idiom); fig. indulging in a life of luxury
